page.title: 14HUNTLY RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Huntly railway station was opened in 1854. It caters mostly for passengers but also some goods (eg. coal). It is situated on the main Aberdeen to Inverness line and has 7 trains in each direction per day. Most passengers travel to Aberdeen with a smaller number travelling north towards Inverness. The busiest times are mornings and evenings when commuters go and return from work in Aberdeen. Saturdays and holidays are also very busy with shoppers and day trippers. Sundays are quiet at the the station with only 2 trains in each direction. Thirteen people are employed there. The buildings include a ticket office, parcell office and waiting room.
